title: Hooks
description: Configure automation hooks for Claude Code events
noSearchResults: No hooks found matching your search
selectHook: Select a hook to view details
aboutHooksDesc: Hooks allow you to automate tasks at specific events like session start, tool execution, or prompt submission.

UserPromptSubmit.title: User Prompt Submit
UserPromptSubmit.description: After the user submits their prompt

Stop.title: Stop
Stop.description: Right before Claude concludes its response

SubagentStart.title: Subagent Start
SubagentStart.description: When a subagent (Task tool call) is started

SubagentStop.title: Subagent Stop
SubagentStop.description: Right before a subagent concludes its response

SessionStart.title: Session Start
SessionStart.description: When Claude Code starts a new session

dialog.createDescription: Create a new hook to automate tasks at specific events
dialog.name: Hook Name
dialog.nameHint: Use lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens only
dialog.stopOnErrorHint: Stop executing remaining actions if an error occurs
dialog.conditionsHint: Define when this hook should trigger
dialog.actionsHint: Define what this hook should do
dialog.matcherHint: Leave empty to match all. Use | for multiple patterns (e.g., Edit|Write)
dialog.scriptPathHint: Relative path from ~/.claude or project root
dialog.scriptContentHint: The script will be created with executable permissions
dialog.previewHint: This configuration will be saved to settings.json
dialog.scriptWillBeCreated: Script file(s) will be created automatically

deleteDialog.title: Delete Hook
deleteDialog.description: Are you sure you want to delete this hook? This action cannot be undone.

errors.invalidName: Name can only contain lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens
errors.actionsRequired: At least one action is required
errors.projectPathRequired: Project path is required for project hooks

howToCreate.title: How to Create Your Own Hook
howToCreate.step1: Configure hooks via /hooks in Claude Code or edit ~/.claude/settings.json
howToCreate.step2: Choose a hook event: PreToolUse, PostToolUse, Notification, UserPromptSubmit, Stop, SubagentStart, SubagentStop, PreCompact, SessionStart, or SessionEnd
howToCreate.step3: Define the shell commands to run when the hook is triggered
howToCreate.step4: Restart Claude Code to activate the hook

logs.title: Execution Logs
logs.noLogsHint: Start Claude Code to generate execution logs, or click 'Test Run' to manually test the hook
logs.noActions: This hook has no actions defined
logs.noCommand: This action has no command defined
logs.debugLogsHint: Showing real Claude Code execution logs from ~/.claude/debug/. Click "Launch Debug" to start Claude Code in debug mode and capture hook execution logs.
logs.startingDebugSession: Starting Claude Code in debug mode...
logs.sessionAlreadyRunning: A debug session is already running
logs.debugSessionRunning: Debug session is running. Logs will auto-refresh. Click "Stop Debug" to end early.
